description: Construction of an additional floor at second floor level; and part single, part two storey and part three storey rear extensions (following demolition of rear extensions) to existing medical centre (D1 Use Class) including associated external alterations to the openings along the front facade
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan ref. 150, received 12 February 2018; Existing Ground Floor Plan ref. 101, received 12 February 2018; Existing First Floor Plan ref. 102, received 12 February 2018; Existing West & East Elevations ref. 120, received 12 February 2018; Existing North & South Elevations ref. 121, received 12 February 2018; Existing Section AA ref. 140, received 12 February 2018; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. 103 rev B, received 25 June 2018; Proposed First Floor Plan ref. 104 rev B, received 25 June 2018; Proposed Second Floor Plan no ref, dated 23/05/18, received 25 June 2018; Proposed Roof Plan ref. 106 rev B, received 25 June 2018; Proposed West & East Elevations ref. 130 rev B, received 25 June; Proposed North & South Elevations ref. 131 rev C, received 25 June 2018; Proposed Sections ref. 141 rev B, received 25 June 2018; Proposed Site Plan ref. 151 rev A, received 25 June 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Provision for eleven cycle parking space shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the commencement of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced (except site clearance and demolition). Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.  Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
